page.title: 06Communication,New Galloway
page.content: Every home has newspapers, magazines and books and the Mobile Library is extensively used. Although the children are fluent readers, they are not keen recreational readers. Unlike the adults, the children do not use the Library Service to its full potential. All homes have a television and a radio. 50% of the homes possess 2 radios. 75% of the villagers have their own telephone and there is one telephone kiosk in the centre of the village. 25% of the villagers, now, own video recorders. A Post Bus(for mail and passengers)travels twice daily from Castle Douglas to New Galloway. Conversation is still very important in New Galloway,with Broad Scots being widely spoken.
